page.title: China Human Rights Lawyers Concern Group

revision.comment: [[User:Addbot|Bot:]] Migrating 1 interwiki links, now provided by [[Wikipedia:Wikidata|Wikidata]] on [[d:q5099726]]
revision.text:
{{Weiquan_Lawyers}} '''China Human Rights Lawyers Concern Group''' (CHRLCG) is a non-profit organization whose stated objective is to advocate for the protection of [[human rights]] lawyers and legal rights defenders in China.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www2.ohchr.org/english/bodies/cat/docs/ngos/CHRLCG_China_cat41.pdf|title=Report to United Nations |publisher=United Nations|language=English|accessdate=2009-05-11}}</ref> It was established on 20 January 2007 by a group of lawyers, legislators and academics based in [[Hong Kong]], including [[Albert Ho]].
==See also== *[[Human Rights in China (organization)|Human Rights in China]]
==References== <references/>
==External links== *{{official|http://www.chrlcg-hk.org/}} *http://www.hrichina.org/public/contents/article?revision%5fid=63366&item%5fid=47293 *[http://www.radioaustralia.net.au/programguide/stories/200812/s2448291.htm Mention on Radio Australia]
[[Category:Human rights organizations based in China]]
